Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n5uhrzXyvG1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1mPwatH"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/4a5d77b46af8385e49c6b1571e7f2632/tumblr_inline_n5uhqihfJq1rr2wit.jpg"/></a></p>

<p>Looking for greater control over your growing collection of mods? <strong>MacTee</strong>'s <a href="http://bit.ly/1mPwatH"><strong>KSP MOD ADMIN</strong></a> sweats the small stuff so you don’t have to. Nearly essential piece of the puzzle is here and many other pieces you never even thought you needed. Here’s some key features:</p>

<ul><li><span>KSP Version independent! (Until they changes mod loading again.)</span></li>

<li><span>Support of ZIP-, RAR- and 7ZIP- mod archives.</span></li>

<li><span>Supports multiple installations of KSP. Change between different KSP installations with two clicks.</span></li>

<li><span>Integrated WebBrowser for direct downloads of mods from Kerbal Spaceport, CurseForge, KSP Forum or other locations with immediately add to the ModSelection.<br/><span>(Supports *.zip, *.rar, *.7z and *.craft file downloads. (Craft files will be zipped and added to the ModSelection)</span></span></li>

<li><span>Add mods or crafts with drag & drop, via file dialog or download via integrated ModBrowser.</span></li>

<li><span>Detects outdated Spaceport, CurseForge or KSP Forum mods (displayed in blue) and updates them if you download the new version of the mod.</span></li>

</ul><p><span>All this and so much more is waiting for you in <a href="http://bit.ly/1mPwatH"><strong>KSP MOD ADMIN</strong></a>.</span></p>

<p></p>

<p></p>

This has been around since .19 and i JUST NOW FOUND IT? *rage*

Welp. Thanks for finally showing me SQUAD!

Also, first post!

wow, should have found about it earlier!!

A very useful mod for heavy mod user like myself.

You can't download the executable via Curse due to their policies (priceless).

Try the main thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/26031
One of the best mods i currently have, could not imagine trying to manage the 20+ mods i have running at one time without this awesome tool

Thanks for the honor to be mentioned here =)

The 1.4.0 prerelease is still a little bit buggy (collision detection for modfiles with the same file destinaten and not all KSP Forum download links will work (damn mediafire...). But i think the new offical release of KSP MA 1.4.0 will come in the next few weeks (depandes an on my time =)).

So long ... MacTee

EDIT: KSP Forum link for full download.

Edited May 20, 2014 by MacTee
Absolutely deserved mention for one of the most useful tools around here (only for Windows, however).

Seriously? I've spent wayyyy too much time unpacking mods and organizing them all over the place...

How have I not known about this sooner?! Total game-changer.

Thanks for the honor to be mentioned here =)

The 1.4.0 prerelease is still a little bit buggy (collision detection for modfiles with the same file destinaten and not all KSP Forum download links will work (damn mediafire...). But i think the new offical release of KSP MA 1.4.0 will come in the next few weeks (depandes an on my time =)).

So long ... MacTee

EDIT: KSP Forum link for full download.

Congrats for the honor MacTee! Great mod manager!
So this doesn't work for Macs? Crap, I was really hoping to try it out.
I work on a Mono compatible version of KSP MA ... stay tuned or have a look on Llorx's Mod Manager.
Hoping the next version doesn't just delete mods that are unconventionally file-structured (like KSO).
hmm i don't have any problems to add or remove KSO. Could you give me some more details of the problem? (here pls =)
